data.title: Database Access
data.description:
Use `arrow` for remote access to the database. This R code will return results for forecasts of the variable by the specific model .

### R

```{r}
# Use code below

all_results <- arrow::open_dataset("s3://anonymous@bio230121-bucket01/vera4cast/forecasts/bundled-parquet/project_id=vera4cast/duration=Daily/variable=Chla_ugL_mean?endpoint_override=renc.osn.xsede.org")
df <- all_results |> dplyr::collect()

```
       

You can use dplyr operations before calling `dplyr::collect()` to `summarise`, `select` columns, and/or `filter` rows prior to pulling the data into a local `data.frame`. Reducing the data that is pulled locally will speed up the data download speed and reduce your memory usage.
